medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly around 4 PM with epigastric pain across the upper abdomen accompanied by nausea and vomiting. The patient reports the abdominal pain is currently improving but remains at approximately 6 out of 10 in intensity. The patient also reports feeling bloated and nauseated, with past vital signs indicating diaphoretic but no fever or chills.
medical_history.family_history: Daughter has gallstones. No family history of malignancy.
